message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DC, cs.NI 

This paper deals with the problem of defending against Advanced Persistent Threats (APTs) in cloud storage systems using a reinforcement learning approach. The paper discusses the interactions between an APT attacker and a defender, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The use of reinforcement learning algorithms such as Q-learning and deep Q-networks suggests that the paper also belongs to the categories of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the allocation of Central Processing Units (CPUs) over multiple storage devices, which falls under the category of distributed computing (cs.DC). Finally, the paper deals with the protection of data in cloud storage systems, which falls under the category of networking and internet architecture (cs.NI).
